content:
Google has shown off a new walking robot at a conference in Japan. Video of the robot, which does not yet have a name, shows it coping with a wide range of challenging environments – including a deliberate attempt to make it fall by rolling a length of pipe under its feet.

The robot is put to the test with a variety of stairs (including one set in darkness), steep slopes in rough terrain, a pebble beach, wet sand and snow …

Interestingly, the company has shown off the new robot – made by subsidiary company Schaft – shortly after putting up its main robotics division for sale. With a new focus on revenue, Alphabet decided that Boston Dynamics was unlikely to produce a marketable product within the next few years, despite extremely impressive capabilities.

Google says that the Schaft-made robot is designed to be a “low-cost, low-power, compact device to ‘help society.” It may well be the expected purchase cost that makes it a more marketable device.

Watch it at work below – it’s a video of a video, but the quality improves as it goes.

Via Huffington Post
author: Ben Lovejoy
title: Google reveals compact walking robot intended to be a ‘low-cost device to help society’ [Video]
excerpt: Google has shown off a new walking robot at a conference in Japan. Video of the robot, which does not yet have a name, shows it coping with a wide range of challenging environments –…
